intro: Lappula deserticola, commonly known as desert lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Lappula deserticola plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert ecosystems and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
